intro: Stenosolen heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable-leaf stenosolen, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, often elongated leaves that vary in shape and size depending on environmental conditions. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and birds.
